page.title: 03OLDBURY VILLAGE
page.content:
{Oldbury}is a small village with a population of 75 people. It covers an area of about 611 acres.
{Oldbury Hall}was built on a big hill called the 'Camp'. The Hall was demolished during the Second World War. Later excavations showed that the hill was a Pre-Roman camp. Flints, flakes,scrapers and borers were found on the site. In Hartshill Hayes Wood nearby more flint axe and spear heads were found. It was an {Iron Age Camp}were the tribesmen collected their animals for grading and, in times of danger, for safety.
The site is now covered by a {Reservoir}built by the Severn Trent Water Authority.
